brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine the relationship among the body fat distribution,
      especially the visceral fat, in patients with age-related macular degeneration in comparison
      to patients with a normal fundus.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Visceral Fat on the Pathogenesis of Age-related Macular Degeneration

detailed_description.textblock:
In this study the investigators want to examine the relationship among visceral fat, serum
      leptin levels, and high-sensitive CRP (hsCRP), Tnf-alpha, Amyloid alpha and Amyloid Beta
      serum levels in patients with age-related macular degeneration in comparison to patients
      with a normal fundus.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  man and women over 18 years old

          -  filled informed consent

          -  diagnosis of age-related macular degeneration

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  inherited retinal disease

          -  other acquired retinal macular disease

          -  missing informed consent

study_pop.textblock: patients with age-related macular degeneration, over 60

clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Visceral Fat on the Pathogenesis of Age-related Macular Degeneration

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
